items.title: How travelling with a ‘real’ camera helps this adventure photographer go into a different headspace
items.excerpt: Danielle Marie Lister’s day job is nothing short of epic. There’s no other word for it. As an adventure photographer, she explores some of the planet’s most visually exciting corners. As a Canon Canada brand collaborator, she captures these experiences in a way that brings the…

items.title: Quiz: Where should you go in Europe in 2025?
items.excerpt: There’s a slice of Europe out there for everyone – and we’re here to help you find yours.

items.title: How a solo trip to Thailand gave me the connection I was searching for
items.excerpt: Sometimes it feels like the older you get, the harder it is to make good friends. But on an 18 to 35s trip to South East Asia, Chelsea and her group share experiences that will bond them forever.

items.title: Behind the B: What goes into becoming a B Corp?
items.excerpt: Intrepid has just recertified as a B Corp, which helps us make good on our pledge to be the best travel company not just in the world, but for the world. Intrepid’s Chief People and Purpose Officer, Meegan Marshall, sheds some light on what goes into getting recertified. Hint:…

items.title: 4 big reasons to travel with a B Corp in 2025
items.excerpt: Intrepid has achieved over 100 points in its latest B Corp recertification, putting it alongside leading large B Corp brands globally. But what is a B Corp, exactly, and why should travellers be looking to book with a B Corp-certified travel company in 2025?

items.title: The Inca Road less travelled: Going beyond an icon on a journey to Machu Picchu with Intrepid
items.excerpt: Lucho Gonzales has been to Machu Picchu about 400 times. He thinks. He hasn’t kept an official tally, but based on how long he’s been a tour guide and how often he leads trips to the site, that’s a pretty good estimate.

items.title: It’s all AMA, baby: The restaurant building community in the Sacred Valley
items.excerpt: The first thing you notice at AMA restaurant in Urubamba, a small town in Peru’s Sacred Valley, isn’t the food – it’s the tiny voices.

items.title: Faced with the unfamiliar in Kathmandu, I learnt the power of asking why not
items.excerpt: Resisting the urge to ask for an explanation during a moment of culture shock ultimately gave me more answers.

items.title: Where to go in 2025 for sun lovers – a month-by-month guide
items.excerpt: Don’t want the sun to set on your adventures? With this round-up, it won’t have to.

items.title: How travelling with strangers eased my post-election anxiety
items.excerpt: Amid the uncertainty and anxiety of the US presidential election news cycle, Leah found her way back to a place of hope among a group of strangers in Morocco.
